snippet: Mr. Fonzi was called Ahab by colleagues who likened his relentless pursuit of details of the Kennedy assassination to the fictional hunt for a white whale.
abstract: Gaeton Fonzi, a journalist and one of the most relentless investigators on the House Select Committee on Assassinations in the late 1970s, who pursued the full story behind the assassination of President John F Kennedy, dies at age 76.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Fonzi was called Ahab by colleagues who likened his relentless pursuit of details of the Kennedy assassination to the fictional hunt for a white whale.

headline.main: Gaeton Fonzi, Investigator of Kennedy Assassination, Dies at 76
